results.title: Modern engines and energy conversion. - rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Explains the various types of engines which convert fuel to useful energy. Analyses the heat cycle of reciprocating turbine and rocket engines. Introduces the nuclear power engine, the ion engine and solar satellites. Suitable for middle secondary level.

results.title: Down to earth city living
results.brief_description: Depicts the alternative energy sources used at the Integral Urban House in Berkeley, California to transform a typical urban residence into an almost self-sufficient habitat. Shows how solar energy is integrated into the house to provide economical and efficient heating; how the roof and backyard are utilised optimally to furnish the dwellers with a year round supply of vegetables; and how organic waste is recycled and transformed into plant nutrients for use in the garden. Suitable for lower secondary level.

results.title: After the glaciers
results.brief_description: Shows how much of the northern hemisphere surged back to abundant life during the periods of ice age retreat. Follows the pattern of plant succession, from lichens to mosses, to a forest.

results.title: [Churchill Island]
results.brief_description: No title or credits available. An overview of the history of Churchill Island which was purchased by the Victoria Conservation Trust in January 1976 to be kept for the people of Victoria. It is a small island in size, yet large in both historical and conservation significance. Situated in Westernport Bay near Phillip Island, Churchill Island was first discovered on 5th January, 1798 by George Bass. A detailed booklet accompanies this film.

results.title: The Rabbit in Australia
results.brief_description: The introduction of the rabbit into Australia and the resultant long battle to contol it. Notes how the rabbit feeds, breeds and survives in different parts of Australia. No other credits available.

results.title: The Dawn of motoring
results.creator_credit: Bill Mason, John Wiles, British Petroleum and Films of Today
results.brief_description: Part one of a 6-part series “History of the motor car”. Covers the development of the motorcar from the invention of the wheel to 1895 when the first cars produced in commercial quantities appeared on the roads.
